reviewText: I love this DVD! Great 5.1 mix, great video quality and a great 1989 show from Waylon! The only compaint if there is such one is I wish they showed the full complete show. The DVD says it isn't the full show, what a shame if true, but with running time of an hour, I think it is or close to it. If your a Waylon fan and dont have this DVD yet, get it! No way you'll be disappointed. Another good Waylon DVD is Live at the US festival 1983.

reviewText: I gave this DVD to my bro as a Christmas present and after I watched it with him...I had to own a copy of it for myself.  Don't even think about it.Just Buy It!!!!!!
summary: The Greatest DVD of Waylon To Date!!!!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: It is 56 minutes of Waylon doing some of his greatest songs and doing some songs of other singers. What else could you want. The audio choice of DTS 5.1 makes it sound like you are siting in the very room Waylon is playing. Waylon to me is the second best country singer behind George Jones and man he sure does deliver a great performance on this DVD. His wife Jessie even makes an appearance on 2 of the songs. I recommend this  DVD to any country music fan. We sure need more country music singers in this world like Mr. Jennings.
summary: Waylon puts on a 5 star performance.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is another in the excellent ACL series, and features the legendary Waylon Jennings doing what he always did best - playing and singing some of the finest songs ever written.  Waylon is accompanied by a great band (which features daughter Jennifer Eddy singing backup), and a special treat is the appearance by Jessi Colter, Waylon's wife and a fine artist in her own right.  As always with ACL, the picture and sound are top-notch.  I would highly recommend the entire ACL series, and particularly this DVD, which offers a glimpse of one of American music's most brilliant artists.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Without a doubt this is one of his best ever.  Waylon was a top performer and will always be #1.  All of the songs are great.  I wasn't sure what songs were on it, but I am not disappointed. I don't think it matters what he sings, he can make any song the best you have ever heard. I ordered this on July 9th and received it on July 12th.  The seller is great.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Waylon is at his best in this performance.  He is 52 and has put on some weight but his attitude is great, his personality really shows and his singing is terrific.  He is a seasoned performer and comfortable in his skin.  He exudes warmth and humor.  The duet with Jessi Coulter is great.  He shows that while he may be older and wiser and sober, he is still the king.  Oh wait, that's Bob Wills (grinning).  If you like Waylon, you've got to add this DVD to your collection.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have almost all of the discs that have been available in recent years.  My hope would be that his early songs would be re-released on cd format and that I could buy them all.  I have a great collection and was very happy to find this one.  Thanks so much.  Milly, Mississauga, Canada
summary: It's All been said...and Waylon is like no other

reviewText: OK I am very happy with the DVD.Sound, and Video quality are Excellent.I only wonder why is this released now????And where the heck are we not seeing more DVDs out there for people like Waylon, Roger Miller, Johnny Cash, Kris Kristofferson, etc.It is frustrating to know that these Legends have made shows for at least 25 years. And you only find less than 5 DVDs per artist, WHY???????????Thanks,Nawaf

reviewText: Let me say up front, I love Waylon Jennings music and so does my wife. But this has to be the worse concert video I've ever seen. Waylon seems so bored with singing these songs, its like he's on auto pilot. He sings them so far off tempo, just watch the female backup singer, she has no idea what he's going to do, that she looks lost. My wife wondered 'did he even know they were recording  this?" In short, skip this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was never too consumed by the conglomerate Outlaw concept for marketing purposes..Waylon Jennings ..is the consumate Outlaw's Outlaw..he stands on his own merit as a true renegade..I met him and Jessi backstage at the Cannery in Nashville, TN in 1985, where they were performing. I remember Jessi constantly worrying Waylon about eating some food other than sweets. Waylon finally turned to her and said "I have eaten so much now, I can't breathe"....Jessi then chided him into another piece of Pecan Pie..This video is Waylon at his best...not all his songs, but a very good mix, and well worth the money
Title: N/A

reviewText: Waylon and Austin, Texas, a truly super combination; it brings back so many memories of enjoying him live in concert. Hearing his strong baritone voice, one can go back in time and enjoy country music like it is supposed to be, no modern pop or whining type of sound.  As an extra bonus, Jessi Colter, his wife, gives a great performance, where their personal intimacy can be felt.Just wish Waylong was still alive!
Title: N/A
